intro: Hutera hispida var. deflexa, commonly known as the roughleaf hutera, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenia plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments within tropical forests. Its ornamental value is due to its unique foliage and delicate floral display.
